reviews.sentence: Not ready for prime time. This hotel was relatively pricy for a standard mariot. And I stay at a fair amount of standard mariots. The hotel and rooms were very nice modern and clean. The front desk staff were efficient and friendly. The bar was a good place to enjoy a meal. Staff at the bar were very good. But the hotel had several short comings that knocked the rating way down. First my bathroom had warm water not hot. It was a two day stay and would have complained but thought it would be a one day anomoly. Not so had to bathe and shave without true hot water. Next the workout room was tiny and all of the cardio equipment was in use. Had to wait. Again if a longer stay would have complained and asked to use a local gym. And finally one night I had a headache and needed aspirin. Asked the front desk who pointed me to a closed gift shop. The front desk did not have a supply of aspirin that is poor. For the price there are a lot better options.

Nice stay. Newer hotel is Irving which is a nice area and convenient to both Dallas and Fort Worth. The hotel is clean everything was in working order. Most Mariots have a large sign on the top of the building. This one does not maybe an Irving thing plus made it being situated behind the parking garage it hard to find. But once we found it we could the staff to be very friendly and helpful and the view having breakfast was wonderful. Next time in the area this place would be at the top of the list.

Great Service. Had heard of this hotel many times but had never gone there. Surrounded by water and businesses but the hotel is beautiful. Rooms are spacious and clean and feature the great Mariot beds. When we got there was very quiet a group checked in and the hotel came alive but the staff jumped into actions and did a great job letting the guests enjoy their stay. Although hard to get to a bar. For a banquet is perfect for a B L D great and tasty food. Nice chef and staff. For the banquet the food presentation was very good above expectations and the taste was very good as well. Well definitely take a group back this property. Either side of the hotel has a nice view and some even have balconies.
Just an overall good hotel clean rooms great staff. Definitely no complaints. Will stay here again. Will recommend to other people.

I am a gold member with Mariot. I travel often. Honestly this Mariot provided me with the best experience I have ever had at any hotel. I am absolutely fan of this hotel and must say this hotel made my trip. The front desk clerks went above and beyond for me. The restaurant staff was the best hotel restaurant staff I have ever been to they actually exceeded expectations that I have for most fine dining experiences. Plain and simple it was everything I want in a hotel. Great room great experience great service. You are making a mistake if you chose any other hotel.
Friendly staff Comfortable rooms great breakfast buffet picturesque lakeside setting.

Convenient location but avoid the food. The hotel is fine but showing its age. Checkin was quick and the service friendly. My room had a great view of the lake but some kind of weird smell. Things went south when I ordered food. I ordered the chicken tortilla soup and the cob salad. The soup was little more than pre cooked chicken with enchilada sauce. The salad was more pre cooked chicken and avocado that had more brown than green. There are not other food options within walking distance that I could find. you are better off ordering in a pizza or bringing a box of protein bars.

Excellent business hotel. This marked my third stay at this very nice full service Mariot Fo all you other Platinums out there. They treat you well here. The Concierge lounge and staff are great. Bar and resto very good. The hotel is not really in walking distance to anything except offices but in side a mile and a half are several top notch eating establishments. Great parking and attentive staff offset the current construction in the area.

Great location needs better food service. Great hotel on a growing area. As soon as the area grows hopefully they will have better food service. Took half an hour for a sandwich and a salad and most of the staff ran around like chickens without heads. Otherwise a fine location.

Wonderful employees and location make this a great hotel to stay. During a weekend stay looking for an apartment for our daughter to move to the area the staff at Dallas Mariot las colinas made the entire stay simply wonderful. Many thanks to Gabby Dylon Jordan Alberto Jose and Juan all of whom were warm friendly and professional.

Nice location and rooms but skimps on concierge. The location ca n’t be beat if your in Irving. You ’re walking distance to lots of office space restaurants and the Toyota concerts. Hotel is clean and rooms are nicely decorated and recently remodeled. Only one complaint. The concierge is a little skimpy. The breakfast selection is as limited as I ’ve seen at a front line Mariot hotel. Eggs are the only warm items available. You ’l find a better breakfast at a Fairfield Inn than here and it ’s embarrassing when compared to a Sheraton concierge ’s breakfast selection. I guess they ’re trying to drive the regulars down to the restaurant in the morning. Overall it ’s a nice hotel and the location ca n’t be beat.

We arrived to the hotel to find heavy construction and renovations going on. When we checked in we were told we would be without water overnight but would come back on by 6 am. This was it the case as the water did not return until noon the next day. I was told by staff that i should have reviewed their website before booking about the renovations. I actually had which mentioned nothing about renovations. The staff were unwilling to help with any acomadations to help make our stay better. The breakfast was terrible due to lack of water the pool was not clean and the hotel room stayed around 78 degrees the whole time. I absolutely will never stay at a Mariot again.

First I want to point out that they are in the process of renovation and that might be part of the reason I was not impressed. The venue was nicely decorated and configured. The food was acceptable but that is about it feeding 400 all at once is challenging. The service was spotty with several of the folks showing a willingness to go above and beyond and the majority just trying to get the job done and a few acting like we the guests were little more than an annoyance to them.
Currently being modernized the main lobby is a little messy but the food and service are great.
We had a reservation and the lady at front desk did not find it. So she gave us a room and when we enter to the room there were another family in there.

I slept horribly stay away from rooms ending in x1 and unimpressed with other parts of the hotel too. I was in room 41 last night and it sounded like there was a a big laundry dryer next door that was tumbling a brick or two. The room was next to the mechanical room so I suspect this was related but I slept horribly. If you stay here not recommended I would suggest staying away from rooms that end with 1 eg 41 51 61 etc. They gave me an extra 10 points to my Mariot rewards and moved me to a different room. I originally paid for Wifi for 3 days and now that I have a new room number can not get it to connect. I called the front desk but the phone rang and rang and rang. I hung up thinking some wires got crossed or something and called again. After endless ringing I hung up again and decided to tether to my phone. I do not have all night to wait for them to answer the phone. Finally this may seem minor but when I checked in I said that I rarely use Mariot any more because they have no idea how to process my crazy last name OBrien. The apostrophe just blows up their system and my Mariot Rewards number never syncs. something Hilton figured out how to do a long time ago. The front desk clerk said Yea we are working on that. This has been an issue for years and no Mariot is NOT working on this. This just seemed so disrespectful it seemed like a flat out lie to me. How would he know that they are working on this. I took this as. I really do not care what you have to say so I am just going to tell you what you want to hear. Anyway this was the priciest hotel in Las Colinas and in my opinion absolutely not worth the extra price. I suspect I would have been much happier at another property while paying less than half the price.

Check in employees were amazing and kind. They welcomed us well and made us feel at home. The property is in a great location it ’s very clean. The employees at checkout today were very rude. Not friendly at all and not a single “ goodbye ” “ have a nice day ” or “ come see us again ” from either of the four employees standing at the desk.
Vending machines broke in several floors Staff was very nice however.

Exceptional. I love this place. The staff was super friendly. I was able to check into my room early and was able to request a Lakeview room. The rooms were beautiful and the beds were so comfy it felt like I was sleeping on clouds lol. Checkout was a breeze especially because it is at noon. The cleaning staff did not rush out or anything. We only stayed one night wish we could have stayed longer. Definitely can not wait to visit again.

I have stayed here several timea throughout the years as we have an office nearby. unfortunately customer service has been poor. During my last stay I tried to switch rooms as the room i had smelled like smoke. i was told the hotel was fully booked until magically they were able to work something out once they figured out my husband is a titanium member. Unfortunately. i lost a receipt of a business dinner during my stay. I have tried many times over several weeks to get a copy of a restaurant receipt. I keep getting the run around we will provide tonight oh no sorry tomorrow morning back and forth for weeks now. I understand it is a busy time of the year but weeks to get a copy of a receipt is unacceptable. needless to say last time i stay here.

Good people but infrastructure problems. Note I am a Mariot Titanium Elite Lifetime member. So have stayed at a few properties. Issues on my three night stay I cut it short one night and moved to another property Noisy. Doors are old not modern more soundproof dors Where was the hot water. Lukewarm at best. I was on 9th flor Cold in bar lobby on first night. Yes it was 32 degrees outside but this property has been in existence long enough to know how to keep the cold air out Worked in room on day 2 until 1 pm. Asked front desk for room to be made up when I left at 115pm. Room was not made up. People were friendly and were trying. But hotel and staff are not in sync.

Mostly nice but no place to get work done. Most things about this hotel are great but there was one very displeasing thing the desk area. The desk chair in the room was a very cheap poorly designed chair for any real work. It was literally painful to sit on an upholstered chair with almost no cushioning it felt like sitting on a board not adjustable in any way and forced an uncomfortable posture. Why a hotel this expensive can not furnish a proper desk chair is inexplicable. Add to that there was not enough light in the room.
